title: Mind Hacking Session Intro
description: This will ensure us a productive time in our session together

steps.title: Intro
steps.description: Let me tell you a little bit about how I do things, so you can get a rough idea about the short time we are about to spend together, ok?

answers.text: Short time? Great, love fast results

steps.title: This is NOT ...
steps.description:
I know we all had our share of things that did not work, so here's a quick list of what we will NOT be doing …

❌ Therapy (psychoanalysis, gestalt, or any other)  
❌ Life advice / coaching / counseling  
❌ Positive affirmations / Mindfulness  
❌ Diet / Physical Exercise / Medication  
❌ Reiki, spiritual healing, chakras, meditation, energy healing  
❌ Breathing exercises  
❌ Communication with other dimensions or beings  
❌ Empathy and having someone to talk to  
❌ Classic NLP / CBT

answers.text: So how is it going to work?

steps.title: How's this going to work
steps.description:
${echo}

I’m glad you asked ;)

So here’s how this is going to work.

I will ask you some questions, some more trivial than others, and offer you things to try.

Whatever works for you, keep, whatever doesn't, file away in the

"things I've tried and haven't worked for me yet" drawer.

Sounds good?
steps.notes:
I will never impose anything on you. You only answer what you’re comfortable sharing, and only do what you’re comfortable doing.

Everything that we do is reversible, and we are only trying things to understand what works for YOU.

If at any point you feel uncomfortable, or something that we do isn’t to your liking, just message me, I respond personally to every single message I get.

I rely on your feedback to know how to proceed. Are we together on this?

steps.title: Privacy & content free processes
steps.description: Most of what we’ll do together is content free, meaning I do NOT need the details of your experience, so you get total privacy.
steps.notes:
I.e. if there’s a memory that still bothers you, all I need to know is “age 12 - memory of shame with 2 other people”.

Or if there’s a person who talks to you in a tone you don’t like, all I need to know is a letter for reference or a nickname, like “when R talks to me in this tone, I get upset”

steps.title: Email
steps.description: What's your personal email?
steps.notes: I will ONLY use it to send you the responses to these questions in a google document.

steps.title: Time zone
steps.description: What time zone are you at?
steps.notes: Use GMT if possible :)

steps.title: Refer
steps.description: How did you get to me?

steps.title: Problems & outcomes
steps.description: What are ALL the problems you want to solve, and ALL the outcomes you want to achieve in our short time together?
steps.notes:
Think of this as a Christmas list. You don’t know what you’re going to get, but might as well go for the gesto, shoot for the moon, and all that :)

I don't need the details, titles for references will do.

steps.title: Problems & outcomes - time having
steps.description:
${echo}

How much time have you been having these problems / wanting to achieve these outcomes?
steps.notes: There’s a tendency to say “all my life”, tho I’d like you to be more specific if possible

steps.title: Problems & outcomes - time spent
steps.description: How much time have you spent on these?
steps.notes: Including all courses you took, therapy sessions, different experts, online research, etc .

steps.title: Problems & outcomes - money spent
steps.description: How much money have you spent on these?
steps.notes: Including all courses you took (online/offline), therapy sessions, different experts, lost work time, etc.

steps.title: Break state
steps.description:
I want to clear your mind before the next question, so do one of two things:

1. Flash your mental screen (like the brightness all the way up on the tv remote)

2. Think of your phone number backwards

answers.text: I ran my phone number backwards

steps.title: Earliest memory
steps.description: Regardless of anything we've talked already, what is the earliest memory that comes to your mind now?
steps.notes: No need for details, “age 4 playing with toys in living room” will do. Some people have the earliest memory at age 3, some have at age 10. Whatever comes to mind now is great. Rough estimations and ranges are perfectly fine as well.

steps.title: Earliest memory - feeling
steps.description:
${echo}

As you think about it now, do you get a good feeling, bad feeling, or neutral?
steps.notes: It matters more how you feel **now**, as you think about this memory. Matters less how you felt then.

steps.title: Earliest memory - feeling
steps.description:
${echo}

Would you like to improve this feeling, or feel better about the very first memory of your life?
steps.notes:
Either this one, or we can implant a new one before that, so you'll have a positive useful "entry point" to your life.

This is just information gathering, we aren't going to "do" anything now.

answers.text: I'd like to feel better about this memory
I'd like to implant a new one before that

steps.title: Past memories to release - shame
steps.description: Do you have any memories that you still feel shame about? Or feel shame/embarrassment when you think about them?

steps.title: Past memories to release - shame
steps.description: Make a bullet list of them, just age and titles for reference will do, no need for details
steps.notes: I.e. “age 5 at home”, “age 12 at school”, etc. Rough estimations and ranges are perfectly fine as well.  If any of these memories have an additional feeling mixed with the shame, state that as well.

steps.title: Past memories to release - guilt
steps.description: Do you have any memories that you still feel guilt or regret about? Or feel guilt to think about them?
steps.notes: I.e. “age 5 at home”, “age 12 at school”, etc. Rough estimations and ranges are perfectly fine as well.

steps.title: Past memories to release - guilt
steps.description: Make a bullet list of them, just age and titles for reference will do, no need for details.
steps.notes:
I.e. “age 5 at home”, “age 12 at school”, etc. Rough estimations and ranges are perfectly fine as well. 

If any of these memories have an additional feeling mixed with the regret, state that as well.

steps.title: Past memories to release - anger
steps.description:
**Anger, blame, resentment and forgiveness**

Do you have any memories that you still feel angry or resentful about? Or feel anger to think about them? Anyone you need to forgive about something? (yourself included!)
steps.notes: I.e. “age 5 at home”, “age 12 at school”, etc. Rough estimations and ranges are perfectly fine as well.

steps.title: Past memories to release - anger
steps.description: Make a bullet list of them, just age and titles for reference will do, no need for details.
steps.notes:
I.e. “age 5 at home”, “age 12 at school”, etc. Rough estimations and ranges are perfectly fine as well. 

If any of these memories have an additional feeling mixed with the anger, state that as well.

steps.title: Past memories to release - jealousy
steps.description: Do you have any memories that you still feel jealous/envious about? Or feel jealousy/envy to think about them?
steps.notes: I.e. “age 5 at home”, “age 12 at school”, etc. Rough estimations and ranges are perfectly fine as well.

steps.title: Past memories to release - jealousy
steps.description: Make a bullet list of them, just age and titles for reference will do, no need for details.
steps.notes:
I.e. “age 5 at home”, “age 12 at school”, etc. Rough estimations and ranges are perfectly fine as well. 

If any of these memories have an additional feeling mixed with the Jealousy, state that as well.

steps.title: Past memories to release - trauma
steps.description: Do you have any memories that you still feel trauma or shock about?
steps.notes: I.e. “age 5 at home”, “age 12 at school”, etc. Rough estimations and ranges are perfectly fine as well.

steps.title: Past memories to release - trauma
steps.description: Make a bullet list of them, just age and titles for reference will do, no need for details.
steps.notes:
I.e. “age 5 at home”, “age 12 at school”, etc. Rough estimations and ranges are perfectly fine as well. 

If any of these memories have an additional feeling mixed with the trauma, state that as well.

steps.title: Past memories to release - other
steps.description: Are there any other past memories that still bother you, that we didn’t cover?

steps.title: Past memories to release - other
steps.description: Make a bullet list of them, just age and titles for reference will do, no need for details.
steps.notes:
I.e. “age 5 at home”, “age 12 at school”, etc. Rough estimations and ranges are perfectly fine as well. 

If any of these memories have an additional feeling mixed with themE, state that as well.

steps.title: Grief - people
steps.description: Are there people who are no longer in your life, that you feel sad/emptiness/loss as you think of them?
steps.notes: Maybe they are dead, maybe it’s someone you broke up with, or a friend you used to have.

steps.title: Grief - people
steps.description: Make a bullet list of them, just name, title and age for reference will do, no need for details.
steps.notes:
I.e. “Nancy, breakup, 3 years ago”, “age 12, mother died”, “Randy, close friend, moved away last year”. If you don’t want to disclose names, you can use a letter or nickname for reference, i.e. “N” instead of Nancy. Rough estimations and ranges are perfectly fine as well.

**Note**: If there are mixed feelings with the loss, state those as well (i.e. a heated argument you had and feel anger / regret about, or an accident you feel shock about)

steps.title: Grief - pets
steps.description: Are there pets who are no longer in your life, that you feel sad/emptiness/loss as you think of them?
steps.notes: Maybe they are dead, maybe lost and never found.

steps.title: Grief - pets
steps.description: Make a bullet list of them, just name, title and age for reference will do, no need for details.
steps.notes:
I.e. “Poodles, died, 3 years ago”, “Skittles, ran away, age 6”. Rough estimations and ranges are perfectly fine as well.

**Note**: If there are mixed feelings with the loss, state those as well (i.e. an accident you feel shock about)

steps.title: Grief - Items and objects
steps.description: Are there items which are no longer in your life, that you feel sad/emptiness/loss as you think of them?
steps.notes: Could be a valuable or sentimental item that was broken, lost or you had to give away for some reason.

steps.title: Grief - Items and objects
steps.description: Make a bullet list of them, title and age for reference will do, no need for details.
steps.notes:
I.e. “guitar, broken, 3 years ago”, “car, stolen, age 20”. Rough estimations and ranges are perfectly fine as well.

**Note**: If there are mixed feelings with the loss, state those as well (i.e. guilt about losing a gift from someone)

steps.title: Grief - Dreams / life goals
steps.description: Are there any dreams you used to have, that didn't come to happen, that you feel sad/emptiness/loss as you think of them?
steps.notes: I.e. “making a million dollars by age 25”, “being voted prom queen” etc

steps.title: Grief - Dreams / life goals
steps.description: Make a bullet list of them, just title and age for reference will do, no need for details.
steps.notes: I.e. “dream of becoming a writer, age 6”, “graduating college, 4 years ago”. Rough estimations and ranges are perfectly fine as well.

steps.title: Grief - Activities
steps.description: Are there any activities you used to do, which you can’t do anymore, that you feel sad/emptiness/loss as you think of them?
steps.notes: I.e. if you used to ski but now your knees are too weak for it

steps.title: Grief - Activities
steps.description: Make a bullet list of them, just title and age for reference will do, no need for details.
steps.notes: I.e. “summer camp, age 10”, “traveling, 2 years ago”. Rough estimations and ranges are perfectly fine as well.

steps.title: Grief - Locations
steps.description: Are there any locations that are important to you, that you feel sad/emptiness/loss as you think of them?
steps.notes: I.e. A house that was burnt, a town you had to move away from, etc

steps.title: Grief - Locations
steps.description: Make a bullet list of them, just name, title and age for reference will do, no need for details.
steps.notes: I.e. “Europe, age 18”, “lake, 5 years ago”. Rough estimations and ranges are perfectly fine as well.

steps.title: Grief - Other
steps.description: Are there any other losses or feelings of grief we didn't cover?

steps.title: Grief - Other
steps.description: Make a bullet list of them, just name, title and age for reference will do, no need for details.

steps.title: Allergies
steps.description: Do you have any allergies you are aware of? Or something you are sensitive to?

steps.title: Allergies
steps.description: Make a bullet list of them, and when each started. I don’t need to know what they are, so if it’s private, just a letter or something for reference will do.
steps.notes:
For each of those, what is your first memory that comes to mind now that is related to it in anyway?

Whatever comes to mind, write it, no matter how weird or unrelated it might seem. If it's private, use some word or title for reference.

steps.title: Physical sensations
steps.description: Do you have any recurring pains, headaches, or physical inconveniences?

steps.title: Physical sensations
steps.description: Make a bullet list of them, and when each started. I don’t need to know what they are, so if it’s private, just a letter or something for reference will do.
steps.notes:
For each of those, what is your first memory that comes to mind now that is related to it in anyway?

Whatever comes to mind, write it, no matter how weird or unrelated it might seem. If it's private, use some word or title for reference.

steps.title: Negative self talk
steps.description: Do any of the following sentences bother you to think about or say out loud?
steps.notes: If you're not sure, say each sentence to yourself, and notice your response.

steps.title: Negative self talk
steps.description: Do you criticize yourself sometimes in a non useful way?
steps.notes: Or say to yourself things that aren’t useful?

steps.title: Negative self talk
steps.description: List all of the ways you criticize yourself, and things you say to yourself which aren't useful.
steps.notes: If some are private, use some word for reference

steps.title: Limiting beliefes
steps.description: Are you aware of any limiting beliefs you have about yourself or the world?
steps.notes: Doesn't matter if they are "true" or not, just things that you believe in, that you know are limiting you in any way.

steps.title: Limiting beliefes
steps.description: List all of them
steps.notes:
I don't need the actual beliefs. If you don't want to write them down, find a way to refer to them instead.

I.e. instead of "making money is hard if you're born poor", you can write "finances"

steps.title: Self concept
steps.description: Are there things that you think about yourself that you'd like to change?

steps.title: Self concept
steps.description: List all of them
steps.notes: If some are private, use a word or a letter for reference

steps.title: Recurring & intrusive thoughts
steps.description: Do you have any recurring negative thoughts or worries?
steps.notes: Or things you "catch yourself" thinking too much about?

steps.title: Recurring & intrusive thoughts
steps.description: List all of them
steps.notes: If some are private, use a word for reference

steps.title: Emotions vs logic
steps.description: Are there things that you logically know they are not true, but emotionally they feel true, and bother or disturb you in a way?

steps.title: Emotions vs logic
steps.description: List all of them
steps.notes: If some are private, use a word for reference

steps.title: Triggers
steps.description: Are there things that trigger a negative response for you?
steps.notes: A certain sight, behavior, sound, tone of voice, or anything that make you react or feel in a way you don’t like

steps.title: Triggers
steps.description: List all of them
steps.notes: If some are private, use a word for reference

steps.title: Habits to release
steps.description: Do you have any habits that you want to change or remove?
steps.notes: Nail biting, smoking, binge eating, etc.

steps.title: Habits to release
steps.description: List all of them
steps.notes: If some are private, use a word for reference

steps.title: Habits to Install
steps.description: Do you have any habits that you want to install or cultivate?
steps.notes: E.g. exercise, meditation, writing, etc

steps.title: Habits to Install
steps.description: List all of them
steps.notes: If some are private, use a word for reference

steps.title: Qualities to install
steps.description: Is there a quality you want to have, or something you’d like to be true about you?
steps.notes:
Let’s say you’d like to be a curious person, or to KNOW about yourself that you are patient, or tenacious, powerful, creative, smart, etc.

Some quality that you currently do NOT feel is true for/about you, but you’d like it to be true. (hint: you can have more than one

steps.title: Qualities to install
steps.description: List all of them
steps.notes: If it’s private write words or letters for references

steps.title: Qualities to adopt
steps.description: Are there people who have a quality or behavior you’d like to adopt or cultivate?
steps.notes: Could be anyone on this planet. Loved ones, celebrities, and anyone in between

steps.title: Qualities to adopt
steps.description: Who are them and which behaviors/qualities?
steps.notes: If it’s private write words or letters for references

steps.title: Beliefs to build
steps.description: Are there any beliefs you’d like to build?
steps.notes: Or things you don’t believe in, which you’d like to? Either about yourself or the world

steps.title: Beliefs to build
steps.description: List all of them
steps.notes: If it’s private write words for references

steps.title: Final thoughts & comments
steps.description: Is there anything else we didn't cover? Something that you think might be relevant?

steps.title: Final thoughts & comments
steps.description: Write everything you think might be relevant.
steps.notes: If you're in doubt, just write it :)

steps.title: Final thoughts & comments
steps.description: Any questions, comments or thoughts you’d like to share before we begin?

steps.title: Final thoughts & comments
steps.description: Write everything you think might be relevant.
steps.notes: If you're in doubt, just write it :)

steps.title: Life after these changes
steps.description: How would life be after these changes? How would you be? How much different would your day to day living would be?
steps.notes: Take a moment to run that in your mind. This is not the time to be modest. It's time to think of your Christmas list, and how life will be if you'll get everything you asked for.

steps.title: Top 5
steps.description: From all we’ve covered so far, what are the top 5 things, that once resolved/cleared, will bring you the most benefits/value?
steps.notes:
i.e.
1. Shame at age 7
2. Guilt at age 13
3. Limiting beliefs
4. Trauma at age 21
5. Grief over my ex

steps.title: Submit
steps.description: Click the button below to submit your answers
